error_details.explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '-' instead.

context.question: N/A
context.flawed_solution:
#### 1000
For each battery that a robot makes, it takes 9 - 6 = <<9-6=3>>3 minutes to create the battery.
In 60 minutes, one robot can make 60 / 3 = <<60/3=20>>20 batteries per hour.
If the factory uses 10 robots at the same time, then they can produce 10 * 20 = <<10*20=200>>200 batteries per hour.
At a rate of 200 batteries per hour, 10 robots can produce 200 * 5 = <<200*5=1000>>1000 batteries in 5 hours.
